definitions.definition: A person appointed, or chosen, by parties to determine a controversy between them; an arbitrator.
(with of) A person or object having the power of judging and determining, or ordaining, without control; one whose power of deciding and governing is not limited.
definitions.example: Television and film, not Vogue and similar magazines, are the arbiters of fashion.

definitions.definition: A component in circuitry that allocates scarce resources.
